intro: Dudleya abramsii subsp. abramsii, commonly known as the Abrams' liveforever, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped growth pattern. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves covered in a powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. It produces clusters of yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. This species is adapted to rocky habitats and is often found in coastal and inland areas with well-drained soils.
